head.title: Man Held in Killing Of East Side Woman

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Man Held in Killing Of East Side Woman

abstract.p: Maryann King is stabbed to death by her common-law husband, Frank Salinas Jr, in her apartment on Manhattan's East Side; Salinas is found suffering from either drug overdose or diabetic seizure and is taken to hospital; he is not charged because of his condition (S)

block.p: A woman was stabbed to death yesterday afternoon by a man she had been living with in Midtown, the police said.

The woman, Maryann King, described as in her 40's, was stabbed several times in the chest around 2 p.m. by the man, 44, in their second-floor apartment at 315 East 46th Street, between First and Second Avenues, the police and neighbors said.
A woman was stabbed to death yesterday afternoon by a man she had been living with in Midtown, the police said.

The woman, Maryann King, described as in her 40's, was stabbed several times in the chest around 2 p.m. by the man, 44, in their second-floor apartment at 315 East 46th Street, between First and Second Avenues, the police and neighbors said.

Responding to an emergency call, rescue workers pronounced Ms. King dead at the scene. The police found the man in the apartment and removed him, covered with blood, witnesses said. He was taken to a hospital to be treated for unspecified injuries.
Although under arrest, he had not been charged last night, , said Officer Guy Braun, a police spokesman. The police did not release his name.
The knife used in the attack was found on the scene, the police said. They said they had not determined a motive for the killing.
